Description: Marl pottery vase with flat base, convex sides, low neck, everted rolled rim, and two short pie-crust ‘wavy-handles’ applied at mid-body.
Curator's comments: Wavy-handled W23 in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery (1921).
Condition: fair (rim chipped); Exterior surface badly affected by salt. Part of rim missing, surface flaking, partly conserved.
